definition: lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Laws are made to be broken.
sentences.chinese: 法律就是用來鑽空子的。

sentences.english: And meanwhile, the militants are taking full advantage.
sentences.chinese: 而與此同時，激進分子正在鑽空子。

sentences.english: Second, the new capital regime must be harder to game.
sentences.chinese: 第二，新的資本準則必須讓銀行很難鑽空子。

sentences.english: Now, the laws have improved, but there are still a lot of people looking for loopholes.
sentences.chinese: 可是現在，法律進步了，但還是有那麼多鑽空子的人。
